beforeDataUpdate.name: beforeDataUpdate
beforeDataUpdate.about: I'm dummy description, please fix me.
beforeDataUpdate.description: Triggered just before chart data is passed to the chart. It is useful if any operations have to be performed on the data before it is applied to the chart.

eventId.name: eventId
eventId.description: Unique ID associated with the event. Internally, it is an incrementing counter that can also be used to verify the order in which the event was triggered.

sender.name: sender
sender.description: Instance of the FusionCharts object that fired this event. Events that are fired by the framework (and not by individual charts) have the framework as this property.

cancelled.name: cancelled
cancelled.description: Boolean attribute that indicates whether an event's propagation was cancelled; set to __true__ when `eventObj.stopPropagation()` is called.

stopPropagation.name: stopPropagation
stopPropagation.description: Function called from within a listener to prevent subsequent listeners from being executed.

defaultPrevented.name: defaultPrevented
defaultPrevented.description: Boolean attribute that indicates whether the default action of the event was prevented; set to __true__ when `eventObj.preventDefault()` is called.

preventDefault.name: preventDefault
preventDefault.description: Function to prevent the default action of an event. For example, if the `eventObj.preventDefault()` function is called for the [beforeResize](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-beforeResize) event, the chart will not be resized and the [resizeCancelled](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-resizeCancelled) event will be triggered.

detached.name: detached
detached.description: Boolean attribute that indicates whether a listener has been detached and will no longer be executed; set to __true__ when eventObj.detachHandler() is called

detachHandler.name: detachHandler
detachHandler.description: Function to allow the listener to remove itself rather than being called externally by the [removeEventListener()](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-methods#removeEventListener) method. It is useful for one-time event listening or for special situations when the event is no longer required to be listened when it has been triggered with a specific condition.

format.name: format
format.description: Format in which chart data is finally passed to the chart

dataSource.name: dataSource
dataSource.description: Object containing the source data for the chart

dataFormat.name: dataFormat
dataFormat.description: Format of the source data

silent.name: silent
silent.description: true if silent instructions are saved to arguments

beforeInitialize.name: beforeInitialize
beforeInitialize.description:
This pre-initialization event is triggered every time a new instance of the [FusionCharts](/api/fusioncharts) object is created. It then triggers a number of modules that need to be setup on every instance of FusionCharts; the event can be used to perform any actions required to be completed before the initialization of each chart.

Because this event is triggered upon instantiating a new `FusionCharts` object, it is virtually impossible to listen to this event by adding an event listener to the chart. By the time the event listener is attached (using the [addEventListener()](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-methods#addEventListener) method), the event is already fired.

However, there are alternate ways that can be used to listen to this event. You can listen to the FusionCharts global events, using the [addEventListener](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-methods#static-addEventListener) static method before even creating a new instance. (The required instance can be identified by the `id` of the chart using `eventObject.sender.id`). You can also pass the event listener as a parameter of the FusionCharts constructor.

eventId.name: eventId
eventId.description: Unique ID associated with the event. Internally, it is an incrementing counter that can also be used to verify the order in which the event was triggered.

sender.name: sender
sender.description: Instance of the FusionCharts object that fired this event. Events that are fired by the framework (and not by individual charts) have the framework as this property.

cancelled.name: cancelled
cancelled.description: Boolean attribute that indicates whether an event's propagation was cancelled; set to __true__ when `eventObj.stopPropagation()` is called.

stopPropagation.name: stopPropagation
stopPropagation.description: Function called from within a listener to prevent subsequent listeners from being executed.

defaultPrevented.name: defaultPrevented
defaultPrevented.description: Boolean attribute that indicates whether the default action of the event was prevented; set to __true__ when `eventObj.preventDefault()` is called.

preventDefault.name: preventDefault
preventDefault.description: Function to prevent the default action of an event. For example, if the `eventObj.preventDefault()` function is called for the [beforeResize](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-beforeResize) event, the chart will not be resized and the [resizeCancelled](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-resizeCancelled) event will be triggered.

detached.name: detached
detached.description: Boolean attribute that indicates whether a listener has been detached and will no longer be executed; set to __true__ when eventObj.detachHandler() is called

detachHandler.name: detachHandler
detachHandler.description: Function to allow the listener to remove itself rather than being called externally by the [removeEventListener()](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-methods#removeEventListener) method. It is useful for one-time event listening or for special situations when the event is no longer required to be listened when it has been triggered with a specific condition.

renderAt.name: renderAt
renderAt.description: Id of the HTML DOM element within which the chart is rendered

dataFormat.name: dataFormat
dataFormat.description: Type of data (__json__, __jsonurl__, __xml__, __xmlurl__) passed to the chart object

dataSource.name: dataSource
dataSource.description: Object containing the source data for the chart

events.name: events
events.description: Object containing details of all events configured for the chart

initialized.name: initialized
initialized.description:
Triggered when a new instance of the [FusionCharts](/api/fusioncharts) constructor is created. 

>Initialization does not indicate that the chart has rendered; it only indicates that the JavaScript object instance (`new FusionCharts()`) is created and is ready to be operated upon. 

 

 [__Try It Yourself!__](http://jsfiddle.net/fusioncharts/5atyLua7/ )

legendPointerDragStart.name: legendPointerDragStart
legendPointerDragStart.description:
Triggered when the user starts dragging the legend pointer of a gradient legend, in the heatmap chart and maps. 

 [__Try It Yourself!__](http://jsfiddle.net/fusioncharts/7jouh8ds/ )

pointerIndex.description: Index of the pointer dragged (__0__ for the starting pointer and __1__ for the ending pointer)

pointers.name: pointers
pointers.description: Object containing the start and end value of the scale

legendPointerWidth.name: legendPointerWidth
legendPointerWidth.description: Width, in pixels or percentage, of the pointer dragged

legendPointerHeight.name: legendPointerHeight
legendPointerHeight.description: Height, in pixels or percentage, of the pointer dragged

legendPointerDragStop.name: legendPointerDragStop
legendPointerDragStop.description:
Triggered when the user completes dragging the legend pointer of a gradient legend, in the heatmap chart and maps.

legendRangeUpdated.name: legendRangeUpdated
legendRangeUpdated.description:
Triggered when the range of a gradient legend, in the heat map chart and maps, is updated by dragging the legend pointers. 

 [__Try It Yourself!__](http://jsfiddle.net/fusioncharts/pboewkxL/ )

dataLoadRequestCompleted.name: dataLoadRequestCompleted
dataLoadRequestCompleted.description:
__Triggered__ when chart data is successfully loaded from a URL (instead of a static JSON or XML file from the system). 

 [__Try It Yourself!__](http://jsfiddle.net/fusioncharts/2cvbm0du/ )

eventId.name: eventId
eventId.description: Unique ID associated with the event. Internally, it is an incrementing counter that can also be used to verify the order in which the event was triggered.

preventDefault.description: Function to prevent the default action of an event. For example, if the `eventObj.preventDefault()` function is called for the [beforeResize](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-beforeResize) event, the chart will not be resized and the [resizeCancelled](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-resizeCancelled) event will be triggered.

detachHandler.description: Function to allow the listener to remove itself rather than being called externally by the [removeEventListener()](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-methods#removeEventListener) method. It is useful for one-time event listening or for special situations when the event is no longer required to be listened when it has been triggered with a specific condition.

source.name: source
source.description: Nature of the data load request. Presently, its value is __XMLHttpRequest__.

dataFormat.name: dataFormat
dataFormat.description: Format of the source data (__json__ or __xml__)

silent.name: silent
silent.description: __true__ if silent instructions are saved to arguments

successcallback.name: successcallback
successcallback.description: Function called once the event is fired

dataSource.description: Object containing the source data for the chart

dataLoadCancelled.name: dataLoadCancelled
dataLoadCancelled.description: Triggered when the default behavior of the [dataLoadRequested](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-dataLoadRequested) event is cancelled using the `eventObj.preventDefault()` method. Subsequently, all AJAX requests are aborted.

dataLoadRequestCancelled.name: dataLoadRequestCancelled
dataLoadRequestCancelled.description:
Triggered when the default behavior of the [dataLoadRequested](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-dataLoadRequested) event is cancelled by calling the `eventObj.preventDefault()` method. The event is internally fired if the data source is a local path or the URL fails internal security checks. 

 [__Try It Yourself!__](http://jsfiddle.net/fusioncharts/y1wf07wu/ )

beforedataload.description: Triggered when the data is updated to a chart. This hook can be used by the theme manager to update the chart data.

eventId.name: eventId
eventId.description: Unique ID associated with the event. Internally, it is an incrementing counter that can also be used to verify the order in which the event was triggered.

sender.name: sender
sender.description: Instance of the FusionCharts object that fired this event. Events that are fired by the framework (and not by individual charts) have the framework as this property.

cancelled.name: cancelled
cancelled.description: Boolean attribute that indicates whether an event's propagation was cancelled; set to __true__ when `eventObj.stopPropagation()` is called.

stopPropagation.name: stopPropagation
stopPropagation.description: Function called from within a listener to prevent subsequent listeners from being executed.

defaultPrevented.name: defaultPrevented
defaultPrevented.description: Boolean attribute that indicates whether the default action of the event was prevented; set to __true__ when `eventObj.preventDefault()` is called.

preventDefault.name: preventDefault
preventDefault.description: Function to prevent the default action of an event. For example, if the `eventObj.preventDefault()` function is called for the [beforeResize](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-beforeResize) event, the chart will not be resized and the [resizeCancelled](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-resizeCancelled) event will be triggered.

detached.name: detached
detached.description: Boolean attribute that indicates whether a listener has been detached and will no longer be executed; set to __true__ when eventObj.detachHandler() is called

detachHandler.name: detachHandler
detachHandler.description: Function to allow the listener to remove itself rather than being called externally by the [removeEventListener()](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-methods#removeEventListener) method. It is useful for one-time event listening or for special situations when the event is no longer required to be listened when it has been triggered with a specific condition.

dataUpdated.name: dataUpdated
dataUpdated.description:
Triggered when chart data is updated and the chart is redrawn, after the [drawComplete](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-drawComplete) event. 

 [__Try It Yourself!__](http://jsfiddle.net/fusioncharts/pfmo5pnh/ )

dataUpdateCancelled.name: dataUpdateCancelled
dataUpdateCancelled.description:
Triggered when the default behavior of the [beforeDataUpdate](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-beforeDataUpdate) event is cancelled by calling the `eventObj.preventDefault()` method. 

 [__Try It Yourself!__](http://jsfiddle.net/fusioncharts/0j7tuds4/ )

beforeLinkedItemOpen.name: beforeLinkedItemOpen
beforeLinkedItemOpen.description:
Triggered just before a linked item in a [LinkedChart]{% linkTo tutorials/advanced-charting/drill-down/linkedcharts.md %} is rendered, after the parent link is clicked. It is triggered before the instance of the drill-down chart is instantiated. 

 [__Try It Yourself!__](http://jsfiddle.net/fusioncharts/sxewndyu/ )

ready.name: ready
ready.description:
This event is fired when the FusionCharts library is ready to be used. By the time this event is raised, the browser's `DOM` is ready to be interacted with, which corresponds to the `DOMContentLoaded` event of browsers. In older browsers, where `DOMContentLoaded` is not fired, the `ready` event corresponds to the `load` event of the page. In case the FusionCharts library is included in the page when the `DOMContentLoaded` event is already fired (i.e. the script is loaded asyncronously using AJAX or by using script deferring methods) the `ready` event is still fired to ensure integrity of all the listeners.

In many ways the nature of this event is similar to the `jQuery(document).ready` function of the jQuery library and the `Ext.onReady` function of the ExtJS library. One should interact with the FusionCharts framework (i.e. create new charts, set options, etc.) only after this event has been fired. This event also helps you to neatly write your code in separate script files and in the page `<head>` thus keeping scripts from being a part of your page `<body>`.

An alternate (and shorthand) method to subscribing the `ready` event is to use the [ready](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#static-event-ready) function. One advantage that the [ready](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#static-event-ready) function has over the `ready` event is that the event is fired only once during the life-cycle of a page while functions passed to the [ready](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#static-event-ready) function are executed even when attached after the `ready` event has been fired.

This is a framework level event and as such can be only listened via the [FusionCharts](/api/fusioncharts) object on the `FusionCharts` class alone. It will not be fired if it is subscribed from individual chart instances. 

 [__Try It Yourself!__](http://jsfiddle.net/fusioncharts/wmw78fq2/ )

eventId.description: Unique ID associated with the event. Internally, it is an incrementing counter that can also be used to verify the order in which the event was triggered.

stopPropagation.name: stopPropagation
stopPropagation.description: Function called from within a listener to prevent subsequent listeners from being executed.

defaultPrevented.name: defaultPrevented
defaultPrevented.description: Boolean attribute that indicates whether the default action of the event was defaultPrevented; set to __true__ when `eventObj.preventDefault()` is called.

preventDefault.name: preventDefault
preventDefault.description: Function to prevent the default action of an event. For example, if the `eventObj.preventDefault()` function is called for the [beforeResize](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-beforeResize) event, the chart will not be resized and the [resizeCancelled](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-resizeCancelled) event will be triggered.

detached.name: detached
detached.description: Boolean attribute that indicates whether a listener has been detached and will no longer be executed; set to __true__ when eventObj.detachHandler() is called

detachHandler.name: detachHandler
detachHandler.description: Function to allow the listener to remove itself rather than being called externally by the [removeEventListener()](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-methods#removeEventListener) method. It is useful for one-time event listening or for special situations when the event is no longer required to be listened when it has been triggered with a specific condition.

version.name: version
version.description: FusionCharts framework version returned in the form of an array, equivalent to the array [version](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-properties#static-version)

now.name: now
now.description: Boolean attribute to indicate whether the event was triggered at the instant of the `window.ondomcontentloaded` event (`window.onload` for older browsers) or whether the window was already loaded and the event was fired to maintain integrity
